story:
Short Summary

  • Who we are?
    This is Shant Khayalian,from Aleppo, I came to Armenia in the middle of the war,  and established my new business handmade soap making, it was very hard with a budget of just 800$, I established my company which i called it "Beauty Products", after 4 years, i guest everything is better and growing up.

  • The campaign 
    Now I have many projects regarding handicap children, I have a small team of 20 handicaps from Ijevan, and 4 children from Vanadzor, 2 from Yerevan and in addition working in the orphans center of Yerevan, I am trying to make shampoos bottles made by clay and painted and made by handicaps, which 2 of them almost blinded, my products packaging are done by handicap people, The new idea is to teach them how to make soaps, shampoos, its hard for both of us, for me to teach them , for them to execute it, because my 4 new handicap students got problems controlling there body motions, but we still doing well.
  • What next
    I will rise the number of handicap students team, help them to have a success and more reliable future and stable income, so they can be involved in the society as creative and successful powerful persons. 
     

     

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our funding will go to train more special needed people to have jobs, we will need to hire accountant, phone call answering, packaging, paper bag making,soaps and other cosmetics producing...
  • People will get special designed soap with your own name, made by special needed people and will be sold by our web site and any market we reach,on the label the story of your kindness.
  • In any case we didn't reach our goals, we will donate to "Hope bridge" organisation and they can buy what special people needs from there list. 

The Impact
 

  • The Impact will be finding new jobs and markets for handicap people.
  • We have 3 handicaps they are involved in soap making training right now, and the clay shampoo bottle molds are ready to go to the next step, producing them and collect my 20 handicap children team to paint them.
  • in any case we can provide people names, organization names and many other trustful people in our society to approve our missions clarity.

Other Ways You Can Help
 

  • We have online shop which is newly made, you can just buy any products, that will help us to get our mission closer to our goals.
story_txt:
Short Summary

Who we are?This is Shant Khayalian,from Aleppo, I came to Armenia in the middle of the war,  and established my new business handmade soap making, it was very hard with a budget of just 800$, I established my company which i called it "Beauty Products", after 4 years, i guest everything is better and growing up.

The campaign Now I have many projects regarding handicap children, I have a small team of 20 handicaps from Ijevan, and 4 children from Vanadzor, 2 from Yerevan and in addition working in the orphans center of Yerevan, I am trying to make shampoos bottles made by clay and painted and made by handicaps, which 2 of them almost blinded, my products packaging are done by handicap people, The new idea is to teach them how to make soaps, shampoos, its hard for both of us, for me to teach them , for them to execute it, because my 4 new handicap students got problems controlling there body motions, but we still doing well.



What nextI will rise the number of handicap students team, help them to have a success and more reliable future and stable income, so they can be involved in the society as creative and successful powerful persons.  
 


What We Need & What You Get

Our funding will go to train more special needed people to have jobs, we will need to hire accountant, phone call answering, packaging, paper bag making,soaps and other cosmetics producing...
People will get special designed soap with your own name, made by special needed people and will be sold by our web site and any market we reach,on the label the story of your kindness.
In any case we didn't reach our goals, we will donate to "Hope bridge" organisation and they can buy what special people needs from there list. 


The Impact 

The Impact will be finding new jobs and markets for handicap people.
We have 3 handicaps they are involved in soap making training right now, and the clay shampoo bottle molds are ready to go to the next step, producing them and collect my 20 handicap children team to paint them.
in any case we can provide people names, organization names and many other trustful people in our society to approve our missions clarity.


Other Ways You Can Help 
We have online shop which is newly made, you can just buy any products, that will help us to get our mission closer to our goals.

story:
In today’s fast-moving, high tech world, 3D printers are crucial for the development of designers, engineers, entrepreneurs and a new generation of young people. So we concentrated on ease of use, reliability and performance in the creation of Rose Go.

Rose Go is the culmination of our long-term research and development work. It combines both aesthetic design and engineering performance along with user-friendly features. It looks great, works great, and delivers affordable 3D printing performance for everyone.

 
 
  •  20-300μm Layer Resolution Delivers High Printing Quality 
  •  70mm/s Print Speed Makes it Print 2 Times Faster than Normal 3D Printer 
  •  High precision

             The core components of Rose Go are metal, which ensures machine stability. And it’s Z-axis clearance gal assembly greatly improves print quality and accuracy.    
  • Premier Stepper  Motor

High quality motors result in high quality prints. A big problem for many printers is ripples after corners and having finer resolution steppers helps reduce that. Instead of a standard 1.8° stepper motor, Rose Go uses a 0.9° motor with twice the precision. This significantly improves fineness and accuracy.

  • Silent Stepper Motor Driver

One of the most common complaints about 3D printers is the loud noise that they make during printing. Rose Go has come up with an ingenious silent drive solution. Our StealthChop2 ultra-quiet technology can keep the motor sound under 10dB, much lower than typical printers.  

  •  PEI Bed

Rose Go adopts the platform scheme of PEI+ steel plate. The detachable steel plate platform makes it easy for users to detach the model. PEI (Polyetherimide) has excellent high-temperature stability and can be used under -160° to 180° operating temperatures for a long time. Compared with the normal frosted bed surface, PEI material provides a better underside effect. It can make sure the bottom surface of the model is smooth enough and makes the stripping of the model easier than ever.

  • Auto-Leveling

Rose Go uses the most advanced 16-point leveling algorithm. The induction sensor in the automatic leveling machine detects the distance between the print head and the bed. Leveling is easier than ever, making print set up fast and simply for beginners.  

 
  • Filament Run Out Detection

For most 3D printers, the accidental disconnection of material often results in failed prints. However, with Rose Go, you don't need to worry about this. The printer includes a system to detect run out filament that constantly monitors the material and avoid such errors.  

  • Plug & Play

Rose Go is plug & play and can be set up in minutes. It is designed to be easy enough that even beginners can quickly get started and begin their creations in 3D. The screen allows the user to pause and save during the print process. Real-time adjustment of printing speed, printing nozzle temperature for better printing tasks.

 

  • Software Supported

Rose Go includes its own easy to use software - Rose3D. To begin your creation you simply drag and drop a print file onto Rose3D to preview the Gcode. The printer is also compatible with other popular slicer software if you prefer, such as CURA or Simplify 3D.

 Reliability is the issue that people care about the most. So we put a lot of effort into that. For the main structure of the equipment, we use the aluminum-plastic composite plate, which is composed of two aluminum sheets sandwiched by polyethylene. After the assembly, we used three integral injection parts to form the body resulting in excellent overall stability and stable, reliable printing. 

 

  •  Design Philosophy 

We asked ourselves the question…” what makes a good 3D printer?” We know from years of experience using various printers on the market that low cost and high quality are difficult to achieve simultaneously. Low cost printers require higher maintenance and lack durability while higher quality printers cost more and are more difficult to learn to use.  

 

Our summation of the perfect combination for a high value 3D printer is… 

"Engineering performance + Aesthetics design + Ease of use"

A good 3d printer has to perform with a high level of detail and quality, have features that are the most essential to users, and have a unique and pleasing aesthetic design that makes it intuitive and easy to use for better user experience. 

For the main structure of the equipment, we use the aluminum-plastic composite plate, which is composed of two aluminum sheets sandwiched by acrylic. The material is easy to manufacture even if it meets the requirements of structural engineering. After the assembly, we used three integral injection parts to package, and the whole after the transfer was loaded tightly for the second time. Get the overall stability, output stable printing effect.

Rose 3D is a tech startup team based in Shenzhen, China. Our main members are the Chinese team members participating in the FRC competition. At the same time, we participated in the sino-us young maker competition organized by Tsinghua University for many times and won many awards. For the past 7 years, we have been involved in the 3D printing industry and specialized in creating innovative products for makers. We love creativity and design, thinking, and solving problems. Now we begin a new journey that combines our expertise in 3D printing and experience with Chinese engineering manufacturing to bring high tech, userfriendly products to consumers, hobbyists, and professionals.  

 

How to ensure the manufacturability of the product?

1. Under the premise of ensuring the product demand, reduce the difficulty of manufacturing.

We control manufacturing risks and costs by selecting aluminum-plastic composite plate materials. The aluminum-plastic composite plates have good mechanical properties and are relatively easy to ensure a stable supply.

2.  Highly automated factory with excellent manufacturing capacity

Our production partner has decades of experience in mold making and manufacturing, It has cooperated with many projects and accumulated a lot of experience.

 

How can we achieve mass production at such a favorable price?

Our core team members are from Shenzhen, China, a city called the "Silicon Valley of Asia". The ecosystem has many businesses, from advanced product designers to the world's best manufacturing facilities, as well as highly developed logistics distribution. The industrial ecology have given Rose 3D sufficient confidence and support.

In Shenzhen, we can have better communication between suppliers, venders, and manufacturers. With the help of local resources and the industrial ecosystem, we can complete the production better and get more components of better quality at a very competitive price.

 
 

 Credit for the Files of Printed Models:

  •  Zombie Hunter Head by Sculptor (Thingiverse)  
  •  Moai by ET-Huang (Thingiverse) 
  •  Polypanels/Coral Lithophane by Devin Montes (Myminifactory) 
  •  Wave vase by PRATRIK (Myminifactory) 
  •  Bucky Bowl by Andrew An (Myminifactory)
  • Groot Bust Sculpture by Doodle_Monkey (Thingiverse) 
  •  Margo's Dog named Eddie by boldmachines (Thingiverse) 
  •  Easy-Print Pokeball by stact13 (Thingiverse) 
  •  Apollo Astronaut improvement support by Charlie1982 (Thingiverse) 
  •  #3DBenchy - The jolly 3D printing torture-test by CreativeTools.se (Thingiverse) 
  •  BB-9 Google Home Costume or BB9 Model by CdRsKuLL (Thingiverse) 
  •  RC car tire by meez (Thingiverse) 
  •  DRAGONLOCK MINIATURES: Orcus From Fat Dragon Games (Drivethrurpg) 
  •  Colossus Bust (High Res) by Geoffro (Thingiverse) 
  •  Pokemon ball Key Chain by Roy-Harpaz (Thingiverse) 
  •  4X6 PHOTO STACK FRAME (Cults3d) 
  •  PANDA WALL SCULPTURE 2D (Cults3d)

story:
(Campaign Suspended by the Promoter Indefinitely) See updates for details.

 

ImageAI - An AI Commons Project

          The ImageAI library is a free and open source Python library that was first released 3 months ago to provide students, researchers and developers of every level of expertise and in any where in the world  state-of-the-art Computer Vision technologies to build applications and systems that has high performance artificial intelligence, working completely off the internet and in their control. The ImageAI project has been embraced by undergraduate and graduate students, researchers, developers and experts in big corporations from around the world who are using the incredible features contained in the library to easily create state-of-the-art  artificial intelligence products and solutions with the few and simple to use codes that ImageAI provides. 

          Current version of ImageAI provides implementations of deep learning algorithms which allows you to perform Image Recognition, Object Detection,  detecting objects in Video and Live-feeds, Video and Camera feeds analysis, training Custom Recognition models and recognizing objects with the models. All of these is possible with ImageAI by just installing the dependecies, ImageAI  itself and run codes as few as  5 simple lines of code and not more than 15 lines of code. ImageAI provides incredible abstractions to algorithms like SqueezeNet, ResNet, InceptionV3, DenseNet, RetinaNet and YOLOv3. ImageAI  saves you the herculean tasks of writing implementations of these algorithms using thousands of lines of code and the need to study the complex mathematics involved.

 

 

We need your Support to provide more powerful features.

We have started work on adding more advanced features to ImageAI as well expand its reach by providing versions for the Android Development Platform, iOS Development Platform and .NET Development platform. We will be using the funds raised to do the following:

  • Train a wide range of recognition and detection models that cover many fields of practice
  • Provide equivalent models of all features for Android, iOS and .NET platforms
  • Run performance and compatibility tests on a wide range of devices for each platform.

          We have provided flexible contribution options to fit whatever amount you can provide to support this project. We will be providing an exclusive, free and fully packed E-book that contains lots of code samples and full codes for many projects that will be powered by ImageAI for all contributions from $200 and above by December. Also, we are providing exclusive and free tickets to all future events on ImageAI for all contributions from $500 and above. Find all details in the perks section.

          We are really looking forward to achieving our target goal to raise the full amount we need to ensure all the features we promised can be achieved. We encourage everyone to contribute to this campaign and also share it to friends and family to help us achieve the target amount so that we can provide all we have mentioned for the project.

 


ImageAI's GitHub Repository : https://github.com/OlafenwaMoses/ImageAI

ImageAI's English Documentation : https://imageai.readthedocs.io

ImageAI's Chinese Documentation : https://imageai-cn.readthedocs.io

Tutorial - Object Detection with ImageAI : https://towardsdatascience.com/object-detection-with-10-lines-of-code-d6cb4d86f606

story:
My name is Michael (Mike) McAleer and I’m a 55 year old idea man. I say idea man because there is always some idea running through my head but I don’t usually have the means to make them come true…until now. I came across a problem and had an idea. Then came a Christmas present from my wife, a membership to TechShop Pittsburgh and there I found a way to make an idea a product but first I have a little story to tell.

Way back in the olden days, you know, dial phones, 45 RPM records and black and white televisions, (at least we had television even though there wasn’t cable) cars had big trunks, real bumpers and plenty of openings to run a piece of rope or twine through. Then came push button phones, cassette tapes and color television. (We still didn’t have cable.) The cars still had nice size trunks, real bumpers and plenty of openings for that rope or twine. Now we have cell phones, digital music and High Definition flat screen televisions (and cable). What we don’t have are big trunks, real bumpers (those things molded onto our cars aren’t really bumpers) and anyplace to run rope or twine through our trunk lids. Making cars lighter, more fuel efficient and quieter has pretty much done away with all of that. Now comes the problem, if I can’t run rope through my trunk lid and around my bumper, how am I going to keep my trunk lid held down while carrying a large object in my trunk?

This very problem drove me nuts. I’d go to the lumber yard, get some 2X4’s for a project but, I don’t have a truck or a van, just a two door coupe. My rear seats fold down to expand the space but the entire 8 foot length doesn’t fit in the car. There is always some, maybe a foot that hangs out the back. I’d stand there with a long piece of rope in my hand wondering where am I supposed to put this? Somehow I’d get it tied down but it was more luck then anything else. The entire time that I’m looking for a place to tie my rope, one thing kept staring me right in the face. It was the trunk’s own lock. There should be a way to use that to tie down my trunk lid. So, not knowing of one I had to make one myself.

Introducing the “Cloz-it trunk securing system”. (Pat. Pending) This handy little box works with just about any existing trunk lock on the market. The molded loop on the top of the box pushes into the lock causing the lock to close around it. Extend the hook on the retractable cable and attach it to the other part of the trunk lock. Now, just close the trunk as far as you can and lock the cable in place with the slide lock on the bottom of the box. You are now ready to go. When you reach your destination, unlock the slide lock, unhook the cable and open the trunk. To release the box just unlock the trunk and the box is free to store away until the next time.

Sound like a great idea? I know that I think it is but of course, I invented it. Now I need your help to make it a reality. I’m trying to raise enough money to finish the patent process and get it out of the prototype phase and into production. Get in on the ground floor of what I think is a fantastic product.

There it is. You’ve met me briefly and now you’ve read about my idea and product. I’m very excited about the possibility of seeing this idea come to life and hopefully become a real product out on the market. There is no guarantee that no matter how fantastic I think Cloz-it is that it will take off. But there is only one way to find out. Keep moving forward and here is I need to raise money for the phases that are coming up. Here is how I’m seeing the breakdown:

To move forward to a full patent (Cloz-it it currently protected by a Provisional Patent) and that involves Patent Attorneys and of course they are not cheap. I’m estimating $5000 - $7000.

I need to continue to work out the design. I think I have a pretty good one now but everything can be improved. Currently I’m on version 5.1 but I’m always looking to make it better. I’m also working on a Cloz-it plus, a trunk securing system that includes LED lights to alert drivers behind you of an open trunk and the possibility of something extending over the normal bumper. Estimate for this is about $1500 to continue working at TechShop and purchasing materials.

The third part of this fundraising push is moving Cloz-it from prototype to an actual demonstration project. The 3D printed model is good but it isn’t the best way to proceed. First of all, each one takes about 4 ½ hours to make. Secondly, there are faster and cheaper ways to make it so that the sale cost is more favorable to consumers. I’d like to see a price point of $14.99 - $19.99. To begin working on this I’m estimating a start of $1500. I’ll probably need more but I’m hoping that the patent won’t be that costly and I can put some of that money towards the production.

If my math is correct this is a total of $10,000 (minus fees) and I put the goal at 30 days. I guess I’m using this as a barometer of interest. If Cloz-it is as fantastic as I think it is then funding should come rolling in. If the money doesn’t then maybe I need to look at it again, back to the drawing board as it were. Please help me see this happen. Donate as much as you can, spread the word or just give me some positive feedback. I even welcome constructive criticism and ideas that you might have to make Cloz-it better. My email address is at the bottom. I also welcome any inquiries about me, my background and/or the product.

Thank you all for your support and interest. I figure if you are still reading at this point you must have some interest. As I said, I’m working on version 5.1 and when I have a finished, working prototype I’ll make a video of Cloz-it in action and post that here so check back.

Mike McAleer
mjmcaleer2@gmail.com

Way back in the olden days, you know, dial phones, 45 RPM
records and black and white televisions, (at least we had television even
though there wasn’t cable) cars had big trunks, real bumpers and plenty of
openings to run a piece of rope or twine through. Then came push button phones,
cassette tapes and color television. (We still didn’t have cable.) The cars
still had nice size trunks, real bumpers and plenty of openings for that rope
or twine. Now we have cell phones, digital music and High Definition flat
screen televisions (and cable). What we don’t have are big trunks, real bumpers
(those things molded onto our cars aren’t really bumpers) and anyplace to run
rope or twine through our trunk lids. Making cars lighter, more fuel efficient
and quieter has pretty much done away with all of that. Now comes the problem,
if I can’t run rope through my trunk lid and around my bumper, how am I going
to keep my trunk lid held down while carrying a large object in my trunk?
This very problem drove me nuts. I’d go to the lumber yard,
get some 2X4’s for a project but, I don’t have a truck or a van, just a two
door coupe. My rear seats fold down to expand the space but the entire 8 foot
length doesn’t fit in the car. There is always some, maybe a foot that hangs
out the back. I’d stand there with a long piece of rope in my hand wondering
where am I supposed to put this? Somehow I’d get it tied down but it was more
luck then anything else. The entire time that I’m looking for a place to tie my
rope, one thing kept staring me right in the face. It was the trunk’s own lock.
There should be a way to use that to tie down my trunk lid. So, not knowing of
one I had to make one myself.
Introducing the “Cloz-it trunk securing system”. (Pat.
Pending) This handy little box works with just about any existing trunk lock on
the market. The molded loop on the top of the box pushes into the lock causing
the lock to close around it. Extend the hook on the retractable cable and
attach it to the other part of the trunk lock. Now, just close the trunk as far
as you can and lock the cable in place with the slide lock on the bottom of the
box. You are now ready to go. When you reach your destination, unlock the slide
lock, unhook the cable and open the trunk. To release the box just unlock the trunk
and the box is free to store away until the next time.
Sound like a great idea? I know that I think it is but of
course, I invented it. Now I need your help to make it a reality. I’m trying to
raise enough money to finish the patent process and get it out of the prototype
phase and into production. Get in on the ground floor of what I think is a
fantastic product.
There it is. You’ve met me briefly and now you’ve read about
my idea and product. I’m very excited about the possibility of seeing this idea
come to life and hopefully become a real product out on the market. There is no
guarantee that no matter how fantastic I think Cloz-it is that it will take
off. But there is only one way to find out. Keep moving forward and here is I
need to raise money for the phases that are coming up. Here is how I’m seeing
the breakdown:
To move forward to a full patent (Cloz-it it currently
protected by a Provisional Patent) and that involves Patent Attorneys and of
course they are not cheap. I’m estimating $5000 - $7000.
I need to continue to work out the design. I think I have a
pretty good one now but everything can be improved. Currently I’m on version
5.1 but I’m always looking to make it better. I’m also working on a Cloz-it
plus, a trunk securing system that includes LED lights to alert drivers behind
you of an open trunk and the possibility of something extending over the normal
bumper. Estimate for this is about $1500 to continue working at TechShop and purchasing
materials.
The third part of this fundraising push is moving Cloz-it
from prototype to an actual demonstration project. The 3D printed model is good
but it isn’t the best way to proceed. First of all, each one takes about 4 ½ hours
to make. Secondly, there are faster and cheaper ways to make it so that the
sale cost is more favorable to consumers. I’d like to see a price point of
$14.99 - $19.99. To begin working on this I’m estimating a start of $1500. I’ll
probably need more but I’m hoping that the patent won’t be that costly and I
can put some of that money towards the production.
If my math is correct this is a total of $10,000 (minus
fees) and I put the goal at 30 days. I guess I’m using this as a barometer of
interest. If Cloz-it is as fantastic as I think it is then funding should come
rolling in. If the money doesn’t then maybe I need to look at it again, back to
the drawing board as it were. Please help me see this happen. Donate as much as
you can, spread the word or just give me some positive feedback. I even welcome
constructive criticism and ideas that you might have to make Cloz-it better. My
email address is at the bottom. I also welcome any inquiries about me, my
background and/or the product.
Thank you all for your support and interest. I figure if you
are still reading at this point you must have some interest. As I said, I’m
working on version 5.1 and when I have a finished, working prototype I’ll make
a video of Cloz-it in action and post that here so check back.
Mike McAleer
mjmcaleer2@gmail.com

story:
This opensource and openhardware development project of 3D printer printing on mold surface will bring an increase of surface quality and printing speed compared to standard 3D print. It will be usefull if you want print the same thing many times. Usually for small series of plastic production.
 
For someone it may be easier to create a mold for example from cardboard than model in computer. Mold will be scanned and model can be modified by computer.

The advantage of printing on mold surface

Increase of surface quality and printing speed was already mentioned. Next advantage of printing on mold surface will be better strength, because strength is dependent on layer orientation. When layers are copying mold surface you can not push in direction of layers. And you don’t have to remove the support construction, which reduces the price and time of printing.




It will be necessary to press the molten plastic to the surface by the air pressure to achieve better properties in this type of printing. A mold  in this technology is exposed to almost no stress so it may be made for example from cardboard or gypsum. 


Why opensource and openhardware?

The openness of project, regular publication of the source codes, models and other parts of project every week provide the possibility of supervision by the community.

The good thing about opensource is that anyone can add some software tweaks or improvements.


Why we need your support?

The money will be allocated to salaries of developers working on the project. The goal amount is enough for one full time developer and one part time developer working for three months. If the goal won't be reached, the money will be returned, because in shorter time is not possible to achieve any result. For best result four developers working for eight months would be needed.


And what you get? 

After the project is completed you'll be able to assemble your own printer yourself (we will release software, models of plastic parts, which you can then print out on your own 3D printer, and list of parts to buy). Or we hope that some companies will start  cheaply producing this printer. 


About Us

Inprimat group is an informal grouping which brings together two companies oriented on software and electronics and mechanical construction.

Detemach s.r.o. is a small company oriented on developing software and hardware tailored directly to a customer's needs. 

3DiModel - Ing. Vojtech Brhel is dealing with wide range of activities on the field of 3d printing, modeling and scanning, he also focus on electrical engineering.

story:
So.. what's the back story?

 

That's a good question. Well, let me start off by introducing myself. My name is Donna, the awkward introvert.  At an early age, I noticed something very unique about myself which was that I struggled to articulately put my thoughts into words. People would ask me questions, which I could perfectly answer in my head, but trying to put those thoughts into words... well that's when I sorta got stuck and fumbled for words. Growing up, I was very jealous of people who confidently spoke in a large crowd. I would imagine myself giving an inspiring speech in front of thousand people. Ha! I know I had big dreams.  

I convinced myself that maybe I was just slow and not smart enough, so I decided to shut myself down especially in front of other people. Instead of following my passion, I chose a course at university which I thought would prevent me from speaking a lot(accounting). Ugh! I can't wrap my head around how many presentations I avoided in school. I got a job which I hated. It was obvious that I settled in life and wasn't living up to my fullest potential.I hindered myself from following my dreams and kept silence. But hey! at least I had a job right?  

 

Fast forward three years later. On a usual boring Sunday afternoon, I was casually browsing through Facebook when I came across a quote which changed my life forever. The quote said:

 

"Consult not your fears but your hopes and your dreams. Think not about your frustrations, but about your unfulfilled potential. Concern yourself not with what you tried and failed in, but with what it is still possible for you to do."

-Pope John XXIII

I'm not kidding you, literally, a light bulb went off in my head! At the age of 24, I decided to eagerly focus on finding my purpose in life. I have always wanted to become an entrepreneur but my fear and lack of self-confidence hid me away. I may never become the best public speaker but what if there was a possibility of helping myself and others who suffer from the same problem? This is when Hey You, Help was born.

 

What exactly is Hey You, Help? 

Wait wait... First, why did you choose the name Hey You, Help?! 

Well! I  just wanted to come up with a name that sounded friendly, non-intimidating, casual and most importantly welcoming.  I want the website to represent a comfortable and a friendly community.

Hey You, Help (HYH) is an online community using video and voice call to connect customers with coaches to develop their public speaking and communication skills in their specific areas.

The official website is www.heyyouhelp.com  It will be officially launched in 2 months after enough funding is raised, however, you can still visit the site and follow our social media icons for future updates.

This is our homepage

Hey You, Help is run by two users

  • The customer - Can sign up and purchase services from coaches to improve themselves. (Like myself)
  • The freelance coach - sign up, post jobs and get paid for their services. They are called freelance coaches because we are looking for self-employed coaches who can flexibly offer their services.

 

HYH is not just a marketplace!

 But it is a community designed for users to network, share ideas and build relationships with each other. The platform offers a forum where users can share information. We offer support to our freelance entrepreneurs through training, we offer freelance contests to inspire our amazing coaches. We also support other users who may not have public speaking anxiety.  For example,  those whose first language is not English and may need support in a job interview, speeches, school projects etc.

 

  

Image above shows examples of  some of the jobs freelance coaches can post on the platform

This shows the freelancer's order statistics, jobs completed with ratings and feedbacks from customers. 

Example of a video call 

 

This platform isn't built to sell expensive or a typical "how to speak in public" courses to you. However, I have created different categories for you to find specific areas you need help in.    

these are the main categories:

  • Jobs (You can hire coaches to video practice job interviews, receive constructive criticisms and receive advice and tips on interviews) These will job interviews will be sub categorised in different fields e.g Finance, Law, engineering etc.
  • Business support (Hire coaches for starting a business) This may be help in start-up pitches, self-branding or TV Interviews.
  • Presentations and Speeches (Hire a coach to video practice or help in preparing for a presentation or a speech.
  • Language support For those whose first language is not English and may need support in different areas

 

 

How Can This Impact Me & You?

 At this point you may say; "well Donna, there are many online coaching lessons people can take" or "there are lots of Youtube videos on this subject". To be honest, if I found an online, easily-accessible, and affordable coach that could focus entirely on my problems, I would have gotten way further in life. 

I mean let's face the truth, most online public speaking courses we see are usually very expensive, takes ages to book, a bit intimidating and general. Our mission is for the services to be "friendly", "specific", "affordable", "informal" yet "Intensive". 

This platform will offer many different services customers can choose from. Whether they need to practice a quick job interview using our video call services to finding a coach who can help and guide you pitch for a start-up company.

 

    HYH Needs you help

     For this business to successfully run we would need funding of $7000. Even though the website is almost launched funding is needed:

    1. There are still few bugs and fixes that need repairing to make sure the website runs successfully and smoothly.  The website needs further designs and content so that it has a friendly, simple and colourful look to it. We are going to hire specialised developers to complete those tasks. 
    2. Cover for advertisement. What makes this project slightly different from others is that we need to build two different audiences for the platform, which are the customers and the coaches. The funding will mainly go towards advertisement.
    3. Cover for the costs of integrating video call interface for the website which will be about 20% of the funding.
    4. Find ways to use different currencies so it can be internationally used. The pounds (£) is currently the only currency. This will be discussed and integrated by developers.
    5. Use different payment gateways for customers to make payments and for freelance coaches to withdraw their money. Currently, only PayPal is used. I want users to be able to use other flexible gateways such as debit and credit cards, stripe and other methods.

    So how is this business going to be profitable?

    We will charge freelancers coaches small commission fees on the revenue they make from providing services to customers.

     

    Challenges I May Face

    The main challenge I may face is not getting enough users on the website. Basically a disequilibrium between coaches and customers. If I do not have enough customers on the site, the coaches may not stay for long and vice versa. I'm going to do all I can to use the funding to build an audience for both parties by using varieties of advertising techniques.    

     

     Other Ways You Can Help

    I know some people just wouldn't be able to contribute financially which is completely fine! However, it would be super helpful and awesome if you could get the word out and potentially make some noise about my campaign ha!

    Last words from me!

    I'm very passionate and eager to help both parties (the customers and the freelance coaches) This will help me and other thousands of people who also have the fear of public speaking. I want to create a flexible platform for talented coaches to freely offer their services without any hurdles or restrictions. I want to provide a dream for them to become entrepreneurs and fulfil their client's dreams.

     Even if I do not get any funding, It is a relief to know that by sharing my visions and dreams,  will bring me a step closer to fulfilling my purpose in life.

     

    Thank you so much for reading,

    Regards

    Donna

story:
Short Summary

I have been drawn to the siren song of the markets for a long time.  And, just like the song of the sirens, the markets can be deadly.  The first stock I bought was Ryan's Steakhouse, from a cold call by a stock broker.  That was just a couple of weeks before the crash of October, 1987.  I was a contrarian indicator!

In the late 90's, I took a course called Optionetics and proceeded to create a piece of software named Option Insight that was rather popular at the time.  I even had a couple of offers to buy my source code for $100,000.  I still kick myself for turning them both down.

Since then, I have studied so many trading systems, markets, and gurus that I have a swirl of ideas in my head from every chart I analyze.  I have spent tens of thousands of dollars trying to find an edge to beat the markets.  And I have driven myself batty in the process.  Many of you reading this have also traveled these roads.

Finally, this spring, I took a combination of things I had learned about the markets and started trading a system that I now call Nanotrades.  To be honest, it has exceeded my expectations.  It is by far the easiest, most successful trading I have ever done.  It is really easy to do, and I almost never have losing trades.  I know, it sounds too good to be true.  So I will have to prove it to you.

I have been trading this retirement account of my father's since May 30, 2017.  (Your father's retirement account is not something you want to lose!)  I have posted every day's statement at the Trade Unafraid blog, but I will hit the highlights for you here, so you can see how this amazing system makes about 3% each month.

Here is the first daily statement, before I had place any trades.  So the account starts with $99,750.03 in cash.

By the end of May, two trading days later, the cash balance was nearly $101k, and the net liquidating value was up slightly.  Net liquidating value is what the account would be worth in cash if you were to close all open trades at their current price.

By the end of June, the cash balance was over $104k, and the net liq value was over $102k.

By the end of July, the cash balance was just under $106.7k, and the net liq value was $106k.

As of Friday's close on August 25, the cash balance is over $109k, and the net liq value is $108.7k.  

At the end of September, the cash balance was $113.5k, and the net liq value was $112k.

Here is the daily net liquidating value chart since inception:

And that performance is even after two pretty nasty drops in the market in the past two weeks, as you can see in the chart below.  Because Nanotrading does not force you to pick a direction or predict what the market will do, all but the most dramatic market moves will have no effect.  That's the beauty of scalping from a distance!

 

Why did I just go through all of that proof?  Because, I -- perhaps like you, too -- have looked under every rock in the trading education industry for the Holy Grail of trading.  There are so many claims, so many empty promises, that I thought it was important to show you exactly what I'm doing for my parents with their real money.

Trading is not a joke.  This is your hard-earned money you're playing with.  Your future, your kids' future (or your parents' future!), your financial well-being are all at stake.  You don't want to lose it.  You really want to succeed at this enticing game called trading.

So many marketers make it look so easy to make money in the markets.  But you spend money on their products, and then maybe you have some success, maybe not.  The amount that I've lost on disappointing trades is even greater than what I've spent on all of the education, tools, and indicators.  It adds up to a lot of hard-earned money lost, a lot of heartache, and a lot of stressful, disappointing trades.

That's not to say that there are not worthwhile educators out there.  I've actually had an excellent experience with several.  Sure, there are rip-offs out there.  But for the most part, I've found value with many, many courses I've taken.

The thing is, just like a broken clock is right twice a day, any trading system wins sometimes.  That's really what makes a market.  For every trade, there is a buyer and seller.

And that's what makes trading so frustrating.  You win some, you lose some.  Over and over.  For me, over the years, it's been three steps forward, roughly three steps back.  Sometimes two steps back, sometimes four steps back.  But, overall, it's been a lot of activity, work, and stress for not a lot of reward.

But finally, I can do this.  With real money.

Now that I've created this system, this long-sought triumph, I want to share it with others who have struggled as I have.  Look at that equity curve.  Isn't it beautiful?  Isn't that what you've been searching for all these years?  It is a steady climb up and to the right.  No dramatic drawdowns, and you don't have to have a crystal ball to pull it off.  It's based on probabilities and option greeks.  Simple and beautiful.  And profitable.

The thing is, it's going to be a lot of work to put this training together.  And I have a lot to learn to produce such a training.  So, rather than "build it and [hope that] they will come," I am turning to you fine folks to take a leap of faith.  If you buy it, I will build it.  :-)  Hopefully, with the evidence that I have provided here and at Trade Unafraid, you can see how worthwhile it will be.

You're probably wondering what it takes to trade this system.

What You Need To Know

Time:  I place trades two or three times per week.  I would estimate that I spend about twenty minutes during each session.  Time of day does not matter.  You can place these trades day or night, though I prefer to place them during the day session between 9:30am and 4:15pm Eastern.

Money:  We are trading options on the S&P eMini futures contract (ES).  The margin on each contract is $4200.  I have used this same strategy in a much smaller account, and it still works.  Even if you can only trade one contract at a time, you can still have an equity curve that slopes up and to the right.

Trading Permissions:  You will need the ability to trade futures and options in your account.

About Me

To get to know me professionally, take a look at my Linkedin profile.  Read the recommendations that my colleagues and bosses have written about me.  I am a sincere, decent, hard-working person who has created a legitimate trading system that can help you regularly take money out of the markets.  It has done that for me.

By funding me, you will help get this important strategy into more decent, hard-working peoples' hands.  You will help the small retail trader supplement their income, provide for their kids, and have an enjoyable retirement.

What We Need & What You Get

So what's in this for you, the contributor?

As I've already said above, this is a trading system that you can do.  It is not complex.  It is not stressful.  It makes steady, impressive returns.  I can teach it to you.  And, for the higher tiers, I can provide additional support, as well.

I am not a certified or licensed financial adviser, so I cannot give personal advice.  And, of course, all of the standard disclaimers are very appropriate.  Trading is definitely risky, and you can definitely lose money.  What I have to teach you is no exception.  And past performance is no guarantee of future results.  All of that is absolutely true.  Don't take my enthusiasm and past success to mean that there is no risk.  We get paid by taking risk.  But these are calculated risks that have proven to be well worth it, even in the past two weeks with a couple of significant sell-offs.

Every contributor from $500 and up will receive the full Nanotrading training.  You will also get my awesome Excel spreadsheet that I use to track my positions, evaluate risk, and know exactly where I stand at any time.

Contributors at the $1000 tier will get a number of additional perks including access to a private Facebook group and notifications of my orders as I place them.  There is no better way to get up to speed on Nanotrading than to learn of my orders as I place them and to be able to confer with me and other traders in the Facebook group.

In addition, I've made progress on several other trading systems over the past year.  It's been a year of intense R&D.  So being part of the inner circle means you will be the first to hear of new successes, such as automated trading systems and other things I've been working on.  There's some very exciting stuff in there.  As an example of the kinds of things I have been working on, take a peek at the original strategy at Trade Unafraid, which I have yet to offer for sale.  It is a much slower process than Nanotrading, but it demonstrates the kind of trading systems I have been working on.  

I hate losing money, and I hate having to rely on predicting the future correctly in order to win.  So my strategies revolve around alternative approaches to the markets.  If you're a Star Trek fan, this is my solution to the Kobayashi Maru.  :-)

Creating this training is going to be a significant effort to fit into an already busy life.  Your support will ensure that the effort and sacrifice is worthwhile.

And if you are not a trader, please spread the word to any traders you know.  They will thank you for it!

Thank you for your support!
story_txt:
Short Summary
I have been drawn to the siren song of the markets for a long time.  And, just like the song of the sirens, the markets can be deadly.  The first stock I bought was Ryan's Steakhouse, from a cold call by a stock broker.  That was just a couple of weeks before the crash of October, 1987.  I was a contrarian indicator!
In the late 90's, I took a course called Optionetics and proceeded to create a piece of software named Option Insight that was rather popular at the time.  I even had a couple of offers to buy my source code for $100,000.  I still kick myself for turning them both down.
Since then, I have studied so many trading systems, markets, and gurus that I have a swirl of ideas in my head from every chart I analyze.  I have spent tens of thousands of dollars trying to find an edge to beat the markets.  And I have driven myself batty in the process.  Many of you reading this have also traveled these roads.
Finally, this spring, I took a combination of things I had learned about the markets and started trading a system that I now call Nanotrades.  To be honest, it has exceeded my expectations.  It is by far the easiest, most successful trading I have ever done.  It is really easy to do, and I almost never have losing trades.  I know, it sounds too good to be true.  So I will have to prove it to you.
I have been trading this retirement account of my father's since May 30, 2017.  (Your father's retirement account is not something you want to lose!)  I have posted every day's statement at the Trade Unafraid blog, but I will hit the highlights for you here, so you can see how this amazing system makes about 3% each month.
Here is the first daily statement, before I had place any trades.  So the account starts with $99,750.03 in cash.

By the end of May, two trading days later, the cash balance was nearly $101k, and the net liquidating value was up slightly.  Net liquidating value is what the account would be worth in cash if you were to close all open trades at their current price.

By the end of June, the cash balance was over $104k, and the net liq value was over $102k.

By the end of July, the cash balance was just under $106.7k, and the net liq value was $106k.

As of Friday's close on August 25, the cash balance is over $109k, and the net liq value is $108.7k.  

At the end of September, the cash balance was $113.5k, and the net liq value was $112k.

Here is the daily net liquidating value chart since inception:

And that performance is even after two pretty nasty drops in the market in the past two weeks, as you can see in the chart below.  Because Nanotrading does not force you to pick a direction or predict what the market will do, all but the most dramatic market moves will have no effect.  That's the beauty of scalping from a distance!

 
Why did I just go through all of that proof?  Because, I -- perhaps like you, too -- have looked under every rock in the trading education industry for the Holy Grail of trading.  There are so many claims, so many empty promises, that I thought it was important to show you exactly what I'm doing for my parents with their real money.
Trading is not a joke.  This is your hard-earned money you're playing with.  Your future, your kids' future (or your parents' future!), your financial well-being are all at stake.  You don't want to lose it.  You really want to succeed at this enticing game called trading.
So many marketers make it look so easy to make money in the markets.  But you spend money on their products, and then maybe you have some success, maybe not.  The amount that I've lost on disappointing trades is even greater than what I've spent on all of the education, tools, and indicators.  It adds up to a lot of hard-earned money lost, a lot of heartache, and a lot of stressful, disappointing trades.
That's not to say that there are not worthwhile educators out there.  I've actually had an excellent experience with several.  Sure, there are rip-offs out there.  But for the most part, I've found value with many, many courses I've taken.
The thing is, just like a broken clock is right twice a day, any trading system wins sometimes.  That's really what makes a market.  For every trade, there is a buyer and seller.
And that's what makes trading so frustrating.  You win some, you lose some.  Over and over.  For me, over the years, it's been three steps forward, roughly three steps back.  Sometimes two steps back, sometimes four steps back.  But, overall, it's been a lot of activity, work, and stress for not a lot of reward.
But finally, I can do this.  With real money.

Now that I've created this system, this long-sought triumph, I want to share it with others who have struggled as I have.  Look at that equity curve.  Isn't it beautiful?  Isn't that what you've been searching for all these years?  It is a steady climb up and to the right.  No dramatic drawdowns, and you don't have to have a crystal ball to pull it off.  It's based on probabilities and option greeks.  Simple and beautiful.  And profitable.
The thing is, it's going to be a lot of work to put this training together.  And I have a lot to learn to produce such a training.  So, rather than "build it and [hope that] they will come," I am turning to you fine folks to take a leap of faith.  If you buy it, I will build it.  :-)  Hopefully, with the evidence that I have provided here and at Trade Unafraid, you can see how worthwhile it will be.
You're probably wondering what it takes to trade this system.
What You Need To Know
Time:  I place trades two or three times per week.  I would estimate that I spend about twenty minutes during each session.  Time of day does not matter.  You can place these trades day or night, though I prefer to place them during the day session between 9:30am and 4:15pm Eastern.
Money:  We are trading options on the S&P eMini futures contract (ES).  The margin on each contract is $4200.  I have used this same strategy in a much smaller account, and it still works.  Even if you can only trade one contract at a time, you can still have an equity curve that slopes up and to the right.
Trading Permissions:  You will need the ability to trade futures and options in your account.
About Me
To get to know me professionally, take a look at my Linkedin profile.  Read the recommendations that my colleagues and bosses have written about me.  I am a sincere, decent, hard-working person who has created a legitimate trading system that can help you regularly take money out of the markets.  It has done that for me.
By funding me, you will help get this important strategy into more decent, hard-working peoples' hands.  You will help the small retail trader supplement their income, provide for their kids, and have an enjoyable retirement.

What We Need & What You Get
So what's in this for you, the contributor?
As I've already said above, this is a trading system that you can do.  It is not complex.  It is not stressful.  It makes steady, impressive returns.  I can teach it to you.  And, for the higher tiers, I can provide additional support, as well.
I am not a certified or licensed financial adviser, so I cannot give personal advice.  And, of course, all of the standard disclaimers are very appropriate.  Trading is definitely risky, and you can definitely lose money.  What I have to teach you is no exception.  And past performance is no guarantee of future results.  All of that is absolutely true.  Don't take my enthusiasm and past success to mean that there is no risk.  We get paid by taking risk.  But these are calculated risks that have proven to be well worth it, even in the past two weeks with a couple of significant sell-offs.
Every contributor from $500 and up will receive the full Nanotrading training.  You will also get my awesome Excel spreadsheet that I use to track my positions, evaluate risk, and know exactly where I stand at any time.
Contributors at the $1000 tier will get a number of additional perks including access to a private Facebook group and notifications of my orders as I place them.  There is no better way to get up to speed on Nanotrading than to learn of my orders as I place them and to be able to confer with me and other traders in the Facebook group.
In addition, I've made progress on several other trading systems over the past year.  It's been a year of intense R&D.  So being part of the inner circle means you will be the first to hear of new successes, such as automated trading systems and other things I've been working on.  There's some very exciting stuff in there.  As an example of the kinds of things I have been working on, take a peek at the original strategy at Trade Unafraid, which I have yet to offer for sale.  It is a much slower process than Nanotrading, but it demonstrates the kind of trading systems I have been working on.  
I hate losing money, and I hate having to rely on predicting the future correctly in order to win.  So my strategies revolve around alternative approaches to the markets.  If you're a Star Trek fan, this is my solution to the Kobayashi Maru.  :-)
Creating this training is going to be a significant effort to fit into an already busy life.  Your support will ensure that the effort and sacrifice is worthwhile.
And if you are not a trader, please spread the word to any traders you know.  They will thank you for it!
Thank you for your support!

story:
• The new mobile officing & entertainment alternative
  • Making good use of your old power bank and portable hard disks
  • NAS + Streaming Support + Private Cloud
  • Black Technology - Simulate the location of your iOS device(Support all the OS version)
  • Auto Cross-platform Data Sync  (Support iOS,Android,Windows and Mac)

  • Streaming HD/UHD films at home or on trips
  • Sync/Transfer Home-Office Documents/Files
  • Backup Family Photos on different devices.
  • Change the location and explore more on LBS apps.
  • Projecting PPT or other meeting Documents

A real Pocket PC, Light and Thin
iToolsBox is easy to put in any trouser pocket due to the supermini size. Its metal body makes it strong enough to prevent itself being crushed or deformed. And we control the weight to make you feel something staying in your pocket but not heavy. Sometimes you might be not aware that a little thing slips from your pocket.

Easy to use it anywhere, anytime
You are not necessary to find the power socket for it outdoors due to the low-power system. Just power it with your power bank. It must be more convenient if you are on a trip or a subway. 

Customized softwares | Support Android / Linux applications
This is the biggest difference between us and other manufacturers. iTools desktop version has been released since 2012. We have rich experience on the Cross Platforms, specifically iOS. We will provide the sync, NAS management and other tools on the iToolsBox1.0 and develop the data recovery and photos backup for iOS users. Users can download and install new applications on the air.

As early backers, we will provide the 20% discount and free shipping. It must be a great help for our campaign if you can introduce it to social medias. We are keen to give you the best cost-effective and save the marketing cost. All the items are entitled of one-year warranty and one-year cost maintenance service. Please contact us at Discord, if you have any questions. 

Potential delays

All the installations of accessories or components would be completed in Shenzhen, China. However, we are still facing some uncertain factors that might delay our schedule. Including:
(1) The potential component shortages
(2) Production delays
(3) Delivery delays

Our team has rich experiences in the Software Hardware Interaction and Integration. We run the similar projects integrated software and hardware over 3 years. Despite the covid-19 sweeping the world, we are confident to finish the production and delivery on time. The latest status will be timely updated on Indiegogo. 

About iToolsBox
The color of the extended module that used for extension points might be changed to gray when we start the production. The prototype1.0 is handmade and we are considering the color difference problem.

Please read the above contents and make sure you can accept these. We hope to build a long-term relationship with customers and keep up developing more and more interesting products through the crowdfunding mode.

If we can succeed in this campaign, we will start the affiliate work and other marketing cooperations due to part of prior development cost can be saved. We remain a regular profit space to maintain the production. Others should be used in the affiliates or marketing campaigns.

story:
What is M.A.P.?

The M.A.P. (Miniature Automotive Project) consists of lifelike 1:6 scale models that represent the fundamental systems that make up an automobile.
The project consists of four kits to assemble and the combination of the four kits results in the formation of a generic model of the internal structure of an automobile and its main elements. In addition to the four kits to be assembled, a pre-assembled version of a 16-valve engine on the scale of 1:6 is also part of the project. 
 
 
The body of the subassemblies is transparent, which enables visualisation   of the internal parts of the system. It is also possible to see the movement of each part inside the system, a feature that realistically reproduces the real movements of the internal part of an automobile.
 
 
Once the campaign is complete and we are launched, we will be able to make each piece available separately
 
You will be able to observe and compare the movements of each structure individually and together. In addition, the structures are transparent allowing a clear and objective view of the observed system.
 

Complete Kit - Demonstration

 

  • It shows what happens when the gear-shift lever is set to the desired gear. The repercussion of the movement is transformed into other movements through the “shifting level” shafts resulting in the synchronizer coupling of the chosen gear.  Note: In the video demonstration, the shaft is disconnected to be able to better show the movement, because it is very short, and almost imperceptible.
  • The movement of the shaft illustrates the entry of air and fuel into the cylinders as well as the exhaust gases from the explosion. It is 16-valve control (16V), i.e., 4 valves per cylinder.  The shafts are made of metal alloys, the valves of ABS or worked metal and the body of the cylinder head of transparent PC plastic.
  •  This image shows the crankshaft connection to the camshafts by a serrated belt. It is possible to observe an axle-shaft coming from the transmission gearbox connected to the engine. It also shows part of the intake manifold system and injector nozzles.  The serrated pulleys of the camshaft are made of a metallic material. 
  Engine System +Transmission System + Suspension System +Brake and Steering Systems
Engine System - Kits of parts that assemble a generic, transparent engine block that allows you to see the internal parts.
Transmission System - Kit of parts that assemble a front-wheel drive transmission system. The entire system is assembled in a transparent casing, allowing you to see the internal parts.
Suspension System - Kit of parts that assemble the front and rear axles of a modern vehicle.  The suspension is multi-link and is suitable for the front-wheel drive model.
Brake and steering System - Kit of parts that assemble the four-wheel disc braking system.

 

 

 

The Complete Kit is the combination of all of the above kits!

 

 

Complete Kit (Perk)

 Complete kit is the combination of 4 kits: : Engine System, Transmission System, Suspension System, Brake and Steering Systems. When you choosee the Complete Kit, you will recive each kit in 4 differents packages with spaces to store each piece.  You also will recieve a tool kit for free(only during crowdfunding period). 
All of the kits are made of injected ABS and PC plastic with metal alloy parts. Once all of the modules have been assembled, you will have a 1/6 scale model of a car.
 

 

 

 

Individual Kits

If you don't need the Complete Kit (Engine System, Transmission System, Suspension System, Brake and Steering Systems)  but you want a Miniature Model in 1:6 scale to assemble, you can choose the individual kit you prefer (Engine System, Transmission System, SuspensionSystem, Brake and Steering  Systems).
Each individual kit includes instruction      manual and a special packaging with    space to store each piece.

 

Assembled Engine 16-valve (Perk) 

In addition to the kits to be assembled, the already assembled electric version of a 16 V engine is also part of the project. Although it is a miniature, its clear material and scale allows a clear and objective visualization of the system being studied.
Besides being recreational, it is an enriching activity very useful in the mechanical field.

 

The video below shows the Motor Assembled Engine (Scale 1:6) :

 

Once the campaign is complete and we are launched, we will be able to make each piece available separately

 

M.A.P applications

 

  • Hobby

The niche of technical modelling is a commonly practised activity. It encompasses a very large range of professionals from different fields. From students to doctors,

 

  • Education

In the field of ​​education, the Miniature Automotive Project will help make classes and laboratories more practical and intuitive, enabling students to learn through practical projects, and eliminate the need for large spaces with real models, reducing costs.

 
  • Institutional Promotional Gifts

Automotive Mechanics comprises a large number of parts that are manufactured by numerous companies. Most of these parts are elements of assembly kits.  They can be sold separately to these manufacturers, where they can be used as gifts in their marketing campaigns.

 

Transmission System Kit  (Perk)

 

                     

 

 

Brake and Steering System Kit (Perk)

 

     

 

 

Engine System Kit (Perk)

 

   

 

 

Suspension System Kit (Perk)

             

 

Complete Kit - 3D View 

 

 

 

 

You are in good hands!

 

 

 
Fabio Neto  (M.A.P. Founder): Fabio works with scale models for more than 10 years, creating models and projects for different kind of business. "I had the honour of supplying large companies in my region. A fine reputation was well earned from the quality of my products and the commitment of my team. I have discovered that work carried out with happiness produces a result much greater than the value it has received."
Rodrigo Marino (M.A.P. Team): Rodrigo is graduated in electrotechnology and he is working to develop all the eletronic updates that will be disponibilized to our customers improve their M.A.P Kit after the crowdfunding campaign. "Since I was young I love techology and business, now I have opportunity to work on a project that mix both". He is also the guy behind marketing campaign and the support with customers.
 

 

Body 

Subscribe our email list and recieve the body file to download for free.    

 
 

 

Timeline 

 

M.A.P.

The proposal of the Miniature Automotive Project design over time is to be able to offer different types of mechanical systems. Such as, for example, types of engines, types of transmission, and other mechanisms that make up the car, as well as offering parts separately, according to the need of the buyer. The student, hobbyist or enthusiast can assemble their model according to a study schedule or however they see fit. 
Once all of the modules have been assembled, you will have a 1/6 scale model of a car.
And you can even sign your name on the serial number tab of the bodywork.
We want to know your opinion. If you have any suggestions or ideas for improving the M.A.P.  kits, please contact us through our website, emails or social networks.
Thank you!

story:
TL;DR

A social network application based on the self-made community's topics like Mobile, Fashion, Art, Movies, Gaming, Trade and everything else you would like. There are topic parents and their sub-topic which you can build your feed upon them.

 

 

In details

Our vision is to bring back the forums websites we all used to enjoy exploring them on the computer. As we mentioned above, Topitrend is a social network application based on topics like Mobile, Fashion, Art, Movies, Gaming, Trade and much more. There are topic parents and their sub-topics which you can build your feed upon them.

Sounds great but that’s not all, the main advantage is the ability to self-manage your feed to have all of your favorite topics which you follow them, made by the community itself, to be and to get exposed without depending on your friend list.

Another great thing is that you are getting exposed to all of the topics that you can ever imagine and also some that you didn’t know before.

We want to give you an access to a big and diverse community which all of its purposes is to share, pass information and getting feedbacks all throughout their favorite topics. All of that, with a unique and easy platform with an option to mention friends, share GIFs, photos and much more.

Everyone gets their opportunity to open and manage their own topic and the exposure gets equal between all topics according to their Parent's topic.

On top of all that, you can online chat with friends, follow your friends or users that you liked, notification system, privacy control and much more features that we're working on them that will make you enjoy our app even more!

 

About our selves

It all began in one evening, on our way back to the train station after a day at the college, it was a long walk and we started bringing up memories when we used to be on the computer all the time and surfing across the web exploring and managing forum topics on our own. We remembered how lucky we were to discover this world at such a young age, which gave us all of our knowledge we currently have.
Today, as our world passed into the mobile platform, it seems like the forums platform hasn't got its proper place.

We invested a lot of thoughts about how can we design this desktop-based platform in a mobile-friendly way so it won’t harm the user experience while including all features.

So after almost 7 months of continuous work, on our free time between our jobs and late night hours, we are finally in the prototype final stages of our Android application.

We thought it will be easy… But now we can see it won’t be that easy and that’s why we need your help to bring this idea to life.

Your contribution will help us on many difficulties we had to deal with, such as keeping our entire content safe for you to read including children, complicated development of our platform with an emphasis on making it available to everyone around the world, in addition, continuation of the iOS development process, and of course server maintenance and everything else that comes out of it.

 

Download

We invite you to download our prototype app from Google Play Store to get your first impressions.

Thanks for supporting us!

story:
Short Summary

There are options available for languages learners, sure, but those options all fall short in one way or another. You can commit yourself wholeheartedly to learning the language of your choice and still not reach your goals while using these product!

Here’s the problem: 60% of the world’s population learns better through visual methods. Combined with an application that helps you to form a daily habit out of language learning, this knowledge makes it possible for you to dramatically enhance your language education. We are also working a voice translation feature into our product in order to bring the spoken language into this product in a big way.

Wwordy is based on tried-and-true principles, helping you to learn one word at a time via information that is presented in a bright, attractive, visual manner. With Wwordy, you will find yourself picking up English, Hebrew, or Spanish at a rate that you previously may have thought to be impossible.

We plan on offering our app to schools and kindergartens free of charge, and we will reward our users for their successes, leading to higher engagement rates and a more useful interface for potential advertisers.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Right now, we are looking to you, for help raising at least $10,000. These funds will cover the costs of completing development on Wwordy and then publishing and marketing our app to a global audience and putting out our English course.

Should we raise $30,000, we will work on Spanish and Hebrew as well, and should we raise $360,000, we will work on English, Spanish, Hebrew, Mandarin Chinese, Hindi, Arabic, Portuguese, Russian, Japanese, German, Ukrainian, and French.

As a thank-you, we are offering some enticing rewards for our contributors, including merchandise branded with the Wwordy logo and access to the premium version of the app.

 

 

The Impact

By making it easier for people to learn English, Spanish and other languages we are making the world a more interconnected place. We are making the world a more interconnected place. We believe strongly in the value of language learning, which is why we are so intent on making it easier than it has ever been before.

 

Risks & Challenges

The market for this type of app has already been proven through the positive receptions that have met Duolingo, Lingualeo, and other language learning tools. We will avoid a risky launch by not positioning ourselves as a competitors to these apps. Rather, we are a means to rounding out your language education and making it easier for you to turn language learning into a steady habit.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Outside of contributing monetarily, you can help us by sharing our campaign with everyone you know. Facebook, Twitter, Instagram: these are all outstanding platforms for spreading the good news that Wwordy is here. All contributions, monetary and non-monetary, are greatly appreciated. Thank you for taking the time to read about what we are doing.

story:
Short Summary

I am Kwaku Kuffour the principal director of L&K Consult Ltd a technology firm (http://www.lnkconsult.com) with a focus on ecommerce solutions and payment services. For the past 10 years i have worked in technology innovation and service provision. All of this time has been spent with Start-Ups and small business.  During this time i worked primarily as software engineer and moved on to a role of technology management and innovation. During this period i worked on some very exciting projects such as Value added SMS applications, portable payment systems for the ECG and mobile banking applications for a few rural banks in ghana during my time at SMSGH.  Much later i worked on an electronic top API, developing  and leading integration with Nigerian  telcos for AfricXpress. Now i spend most of my time strategizing and implementing ideas which use ecommerce(mobile/web) to enhance business activities such an http://www.nallemonlinestore and http://www.edwa-gh.com a multi merchant market place.

During my time working and interacting with Start-Ups and SMEs it became obvious that most did not have a way to get a holistic view of their business at any given point in time and those who did it came at great cost to them.  Since starting my own business i have come to even appreciate this predicament even more, that is the driving force behind the idea of Loop Finance an online tool with a corresponding mobile application which will go a long way to address this issue. At the same time making it accessible to all SMEs at a fee of next to nothing. The reason primarily being we want SMEs such as ourselves to function well and effectively.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Per our analysis we need approximately USD11,000 - 15000 over a period of 6 - 8 months to achieve this goal. This investment will go towards the following
    • Application development cost and Scaling Engineering team - online platform, corresponding mobile application and API for third party integrators
    • Application server cost  - covering a period of 2 - 3 years
    • Marketing material design and acquisition
    • Initial marketing, service awareness, SMEs and service provider on-boarding
  • We will keep all contributors involved in each stage of our development, informing and let them have a first access to our platform. We also intend let contributors who find our platform interesting beyond just contributing to come onboard in whatever capacity that may be. This can be in the form of technical, marketing or service strategy. Ideally we hope the our contributors will take a more hands on approach and would like to get involved beyond just their contribution
  • Due to the project structure whether we meet our financial target or not we will proceed with the project. Reason being we are willing to absorb some of this cost ourselves and therefore we will put in our resources as much as much as we need your contribution to complement our efforts.

The Impact

  • We believe this platform will enhance SMEs and their operation. The ability to perform such data analysis and forecast will help them to tow the right direction and avoid collapse, with the knock on effect being able to scale and grow and create more jobs and contribute to the sustainability of the economy. Start-ups which use this platform will avoid the pitfalls which has befallen a lot of them due to not being able to get a holistic  view of their business.
  • Over the years myself and my team have worked on some project and seen them to completion.Most recently examples of some these projects is http://www.nallemonlinstore.com which allowed them to extend their precense beyond their physical stores. Another project we have successfully completed is http://www.edwa-gh.com  which is a online market place for merchants who want a shared space to sell their wares. We also developed a mobile application for Nallem Clothing which has the full functionality of their online store.
  • As i mentioned earlier we are a ghanaian registered business under the name of L&K Consult Limited and our services and some of our clients can be found on our website http://www.lnkconsult.com

Risks & Challenges

  • We understand that with an projects there can be unforseen circumstances that can greatly impact the deliverables. Not withstanding that we are confident that we can meet the delivery schedule of this  project.
  • However with any project allowances and alternatives have to be made for such issues, we have broken down this project into a number of phases. Development,  Testing, Service Awarness, Service provider acquisition and SMEs onboarding. We take the view that broken into such chunks we can be focal with our efforts and address any specifics needs rapidly, where we need to increase capabilities to meet goals we will. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • We would appreciate any help given, even those who cannot contribute but share our campaign and inform others we will certainly be appreciate of that effort. Those who have technical capabilities and are willing to offer them as a form of contribution in whatever small form will also be appreciated.
  • Please share our campaign, helps us to get our idea out and let the public know of the benefits to be accrued to businesses and their bottomline. Indiegogo has a number of ways to share and we implore you to help as much as possible to get the word out

Thank you for taking the time to read about our campaign, sharing and contributing towards it.

We would appreciate any help given, even those who cannot contribute but share our campaign and inform others we will certainly be appreciate of that effort.
